No worries, everything is a learning experience. The more you do the more comfortable and adventurous you become!
You don't need anything fancy. I use a 8" sabatier for pretty much everything. Probably cost about 20. As long as it's sharp you'll have an easy time of things. Concentrate on getting to know just one knife for everything and you'll then work out where you need something smaller/bigger. I actually keep two of the same knife so I know one is always sharp. Also allows you to cut veggies with the same knife without having just one that you have to wash each time.

Good knives will make a world of difference.

This seems to come up fairly regularly and I've given up porn and stopped masturbating a few days before each encounter but it doesn't seem to have helped all that much.

WRITING.TITLE: How do I "come on" without coming across creepy or needy?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have my first date tomorrow after a 6 year relationship. I've not been with anyone else since her and so I was pretty comfortable making my intentions known before.
Say things go really well tomorrow and I feel like I'm getting good signs (I'm usually really oblivious) what can I do to make a move but not be overbearing ? hell even just going in for the kiss? This is really new territory for me as I knew my last partner for a while with months of sexual tension due to circumstance before things happened (which they really weren't supposed to)!

A chess board. A grain of rice on the first square, two on the second, four on the third etc, they double each time. I like to see how far I can get on my mental board by working each number out. I try not to think about it day to day so I can save it for special occasions!

Thank you so much for putting in the time and dedication to build these incredible experiences for people. I don't even want to know the amount of hours I've put into CoH1 multiplayer with my Brother and friends, but it has been some of the best time of my life.
All I have to ask is why change the UK so much for CoH2? The first one was brilliant for mp and competitive play and by comparison the new one is really clunky. Maybe it's just because I'm used to the old one but there seems to be a lot of wasted space in the new one with lots of confusing textures. I know it's pretty late in the game (so to speak) but even shifting the resource counters to their original position or making it a bit clearer to see which units are red or yellow pinned would be an incredible help to the competitive community!

All I can say is that you are truly inspirational purely for the fact you have stuck at something you love and seem to put everything into it.
How have you stayed so focused on one thing, stayed in love with it and put in the time through rain and shine without at some point just saying "ah fuck it"?
This is *just* what its like to be on shrooms.

So, what do you connect about in real life? What does an ideal day look like for you guys - if work isn't an issue, could it actually happen?
We love really good food, going out to nice restaurants etc, We have really different music tastes but both enjoy a good live gig. The real issue is hobbies. I love swimming, cycling, gaming and making things. She is usually so tired from work that all she wants to do on her time off is flop in front of the telly (or if on holiday: sunbathe.)
As far as problems go she really likes to sort things out herself and gains great satisfaction from doing so. This combined with the stubbornness of an ox makes it really difficult to help her with issues.
This all sounds like i really resent her but in truth i just don't want to lose her because of a mere 2 hours distance.

It is a good thing not to be completely dependent on your partner for your own happiness - but I'm also a little concerned that you may not feel like you can rely on her for support. Is that an issue for you?
She is extremely hard skinned. A tonne of crap stuff happened to her when she was younger so now she just gets on with life. I respect her for this immensely and it has given her an iron will and irrefutable logic but she now lacks any sympathy whatsoever, basically she's a Vulcan.
Why do you feel empty - because you aren't having your emotional needs met on a regular basis, or because you can't see the light at the end of the tunnel any longer?
Similar to above. We just don't really 'connect' over the phone. Our interests are pretty dissimilar and she works incredibly hard.
I would love to live with her again and this time have a nice regular working life together but its a conundrum. We're not able to have that now and i wonder if by the time we do get there the spark will be gone.

WRITING.TITLE: I get the feeling Me(24m) and girlfriend (28f) of almost 6 years are growing apart and have the horrible feeling we may not be right for each other.
WRITING.TEXT:
Like I said, we have been together almost 6 years. We've stuck it out through me being at university, lived together in two different places, broken up, got back together and the sex is great.
We got back together (after 2 months apart) just over a year ago and we live about 2 hours away from each other in separate cities. With very different schedules we rarely have a full day off together (maybe 10 days a year) and our evenings together are usually around 2 weeks apart.
It's putting the strain on. The problem is we are both extremely individual people and although I pine a little for her it's pretty clear she doesn't "need" me. We don't talk a lot on the phone and if we do its short catch up conversations which I come away from feeling pretty empty.
I love her and she loves me, in the recent past I was pretty certain I was going to propose. we have talked about her moving up to me (london) but it definitely won't be this year. At this point I'm wondering if we would be better off separate so we can go about our lives not have to worry about putting time aside to maintain something just so it can be great in some imaginary future.
---
**tl;dr**: Long term GF and I may be growing apart. Not sure if we are right for each other anymore.
He sounds like a gay, white Morgan Freeman
